column2: SOUTH DAKOTA PERMIT TEST
column4: South Dakota
column6: SD

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:
column4: is the best option during winter.
column6: causes the front wheels to lock.
column8: keeps the brakes from freezing.

column2: 2. Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
column4: you are following a bicyclist or motorcyclist across railroad tracks.
column6: you are not wearing safety belts.
column8: you don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.

column2: 3. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column4: after you enter the crosswalk.
column6: before you enter the intersection.
column8: before you enter the crosswalk.

column2: 4. When riding in a vehicle equipped with air bags is, children ages 12 and under are safer:
column4: buckled up in the back seat.
column6: buckled up in the front seat.
column8: in the bed of a pick-up truck.

column2: 5. This warning sign:
column4: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column6: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column8: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.

column2: 6. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column6: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column8: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Side road
column6: Side road entering from the left
column8: Yield sign ahead

column2: 8. When driving on a roadway with a single broken white line:
column4: you may not cross the broken white line.
column6: you may cross the broken white line to change lanes.
column8: you may change lanes only if you are in the right lane.

column2: 9. At a crosswalk:
column4: construction workers must yield to drivers.
column6: drivers must yield to pedestrians.
column8: pedestrians must yield to drivers.

column2: 10. When driving in a construction zone you should:
column4: expect the unexpected.
column6: slightly increase your speed.
column8: come to a complete stop and check road conditions.

column2: 11. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: They give directional information.
column6: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.
column8: Blue indicates road user services.

column2: 12. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the left edge of the road.
column6: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column8: on the left shoulder of the road.

column2: 13. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 14. The use of alcohol and/or drugs affects:
column4: alertness and judgement.
column6: concentration and reaction time.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 15. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column4: larger and deeper
column6: less dangerous
column8: narrower and shorter

column2: 16. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column6: increase your speed immediately.
column8: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.

column2: 17. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: reduce their speed and be prepared to stop.
column6: maintain their speed through the work zone.
column8: closely follow the driver in front of them.

column2: 18. When parking downhill:
column4: turn your wheels towards the side of the road.
column6: keep your wheels straight.
column8: turn your wheels away from the side of the road.

column2: 19. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column6: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column8: The bus is about to stop.

column2: 20. Signs that indicate a No Passing Zone tell drivers that:
column4: it is not safe to pass.
column6: not passing other vehicles is prohibited.
column8: passing is only permitted in daylight hours.

column2: 21. If you become sleepy while driving you should:
column4: get some rest or change drivers.
column6: drink coffee.
column8: open a window.

column2: 22. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column6: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column8: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.

column2: 23. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: the law.
column6: what is not allowed.
column8: the direction they should travel.

column2: 24. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column6: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column8: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.

column2: 25. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column4: Service signs
column6: Warning signs
column8: Destination signs (guide signs)
